result.markdown:
--- title: "Module 2.2" subtitle: "Accessibility, Clarity and Interactivity" format: html highlight-style: atom-one execute: echo: true message: false warning: false --- ## Prework - Install plotly `install.packages("plotly")` - Install colorBlindness Guide `install.packages("colorBlindness")` Familiarize yourself with this setup code and the dataframes it generates. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(readr) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(wbstats) library(countrycode) indicators = c(flfp = "SL.TLF.CACT.FE.ZS", gdp_pc = "NY.GDP.PCAP.KD") # define indicators ## Regional levels of FLFP for column chart flfp_gdp_regions <- wb_data("SL.TLF.CACT.FE.ZS", country = "regions_only", mrnev = 1) |> rename( region = country, year = date, flfp = SL.TLF.CACT.FE.ZS ) |> select(region, iso3c, year, flfp) flfp_gdp_regions ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 7 × 4 region iso3c year flfp 1 East Asia & Pacific EAS 2021 58.9 2 Europe & Central Asia ECS 2021 51.6 3 Latin America & Caribbean LCN 2021 49.8 4 Middle East & North Africa MEA 2021 18.2 5 North America NAC 2021 56.1 6 South Asia SAS 2021 24.8 7 Sub-Saharan Africa SSF 2021 60.4 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ## Cross-section of data on FLFP and GDP per capita for scatter plot flfp_gdp <- wb_data(indicators, mrnev = 1) |> # download most recent non-missing value of indicators left_join(select(wb_countries(), c(iso3c, region)), by = "iso3c") # add regions from countrycode() glimpse(flfp_gdp) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 224 Columns: 7 $ iso2c "AW", "AF", "AF", "AO", "AL", "AD", "AE", "AR", "AM", "AS", "A… $ iso3c "ABW", "AFG", "AFG", "AGO", "ALB", "AND", "ARE", "ARG", "ARM",… $ country "Aruba", "Afghanistan", "Afghanistan", "Angola", "Albania", "A… $ date 2021, 2020, 2021, 2021, 2021, 2021, 2021, 2021, 2021, 2021, 20… $ gdp_pc 30271.8335, NA, 426.0300, 2299.6406, 4830.5963, 36839.8762, 42… $ flfp NA, 16.463, NA, 74.464, 51.653, NA, 52.789, 50.283, 57.779, NA… $ region "Latin America & Caribbean", "South Asia", "South Asia", "Sub-… ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} ## Time series data on regional trends in FLFP for line chart flfp_ts <- wb_data("SL.TLF.CACT.FE.ZS", country = "regions_only", start_date = 1990, end_date = 2022) |> rename( region = country, year = date, flfp = SL.TLF.CACT.FE.ZS ) |> select(region, iso3c, year, flfp) glimpse(flfp_ts) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 224 Columns: 4 $ region "East Asia & Pacific", "East Asia & Pacific", "East Asia & Paci… $ iso3c "EAS", "EAS", "EAS", "EAS", "EAS", "EAS", "EAS", "EAS", "EAS", … $ year 1990, 1991, 1992, 1993, 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 200… $ flfp 66.32925, 66.12070, 66.00342, 65.68375, 65.65046, 65.50232, 65.… ``` ::: ::: ## Overview Discuss some basic principles of design like no more than four lines, arranging bar charts in descending order, etc. Link to a relevant guide. ## Color Schemes Here mention the accessibility checker tools in Windows and OS. Use line chart we did in module 2.1 as an example. At the end of the lesson, ask students to fix it as an exercise. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dem_waves_ctrs <- read_csv("data/dem_waves_ctrs.csv") dem_waves_chart <- ggplot(dem_waves_ctrs, aes(x = year, y = polyarchy, color = country)) + geom_line(linewidth = 1) + labs( x = "Year", y = "Polyarchy Score", title = 'Democracy in countries representing three different "waves"', caption = "Source: V-Dem Institute", color = "Country" ) dem_waves_chart ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: [colorBlindness Guide](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/colorBlindness/vignettes/colorBlindness.html) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(colorBlindness) cvdPlot(dem_waves_chart) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Create your own colorblind friendly color scheme [](http://www.cookbook-r.com/Graphs/Colors_(ggplot2)/) [scale_color_manual()](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/scale_manual.html) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} cb_palette <- c("#E69F00", "#56B4E9", "#009E73", "#F0E442", "#0072B2", "#D55E00", "#CC79A7") flfp_region <- ggplot(flfp_gdp_regions, aes(x = reorder(iso3c, -flfp), y = flfp, fill = region)) + geom_col() + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1)) + labs( x = "Region", y = "Avg. Female Labor Force Participation", title = "Levels of female labor force participation by region", fill = "Region", caption = "Source: World Bank" ) flfp_region + scale_fill_manual(values = cb_palette) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region <- flfp_region + scale_fill_manual(values = cb_palette) cvdPlot(flfp_region) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Use Viridis [viridis()](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/viridis/vignettes/intro-to-viridis.html) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region + scale_fill_viridis_d() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region <- flfp_region + scale_fill_viridis_d() cvdPlot(flfp_region) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ### Use R color brewer [color brewer](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/scale_brewer.html) [palette selector tool](https://colorbrewer2.org/) Show how it works with YlGn but does not work with with BlGn ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlGn") # try with BrBG ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region <- flfp_region + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlGn") cvdPlot(flfp_region) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Scaling for scatterplots an line charts Use "scale_color" instead of "scale_fill" for line charts and scatter plots, e.g. `scale_color_manual()`, `scale_color_viridis_d()`, `scale_color_brewer`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wealth_flfp <- ggplot(flfp_gdp, aes(x = gdp_pc, y = flfp)) + # plot gdp_pc vs flfp, store in wealth_flfp geom_point(aes(color = region)) + # add an aesthetic to color points by region geom_smooth(method = "loess", linewidth = 1) + # make the line a loess curve scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_dollar()) + # stretch x- axis, add '$' format scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1)) + # add % label to y-axis labs( x= "GDP per Capita", # x-axis title y = "Female Labor Force Participation", # y-axis title title = "Wealth and female labor force participation", # plot title caption = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", # caption color = "Region" # legend title ) wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line <- ggplot(flfp_ts, aes(x = year, y = flfp, color = region)) + geom_line(linewidth = 1) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1)) + labs( x = "Year", y = "Female Labor Force Participation", title = "Regional trends in female labor force participation", caption = "Source: V-Dem Institute", color = "Country" ) flfp_line + scale_color_brewer(palette = "YlOrRd") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Themes [ggplot themes](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/ggtheme.html) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_dark() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlGn") + theme_minimal() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Annotations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} wealth_flfp <- wealth_flfp + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() wealth_flfp + annotate("text", x = 90000, y = 75, label = "Wealthy") + annotate("text", x = 1000, y = 80, label = "Low income") + annotate("text", x = 10000, y = 20, label = "Middle income") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line <- flfp_line + scale_color_viridis_d() flfp_line + geom_hline(yintercept=52, linetype="dashed", color = "red", size = 1) + annotate("text", x = 1995, y = 55, label = "Global average") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_line <- flfp_line + scale_color_viridis_d() flfp_line + geom_vline(xintercept=2020, linetype = "dashed", size = 1) + annotate("text", x = 2017, y = 35, label = "Pandemic") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](module-2.2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ## Interactivity [plotly](https://plotly.com/r/) [ggplotly](https://plotly.com/ggplot2/) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(plotly) ggplotly(flfp_line) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: In this next one, if you don't control the tool tip it looks bad ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flfp_region <- flfp_region + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "YlGn") + theme_minimal() ggplotly(flfp_region, tooltip = c("region", "flfp")) # controlling the tooltip output ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: need to include `aes(label = country)` to view country in tool tip. How to add notes and other stuff with `layout(annotations = list())`. ## Interactivity ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(plotly) wealth_flfp <- ggplot(flfp_gdp, aes(x = gdp_pc, y = flfp)) + geom_point(aes(color = region)) + geom_smooth(method = "loess", linewidth = 1) + scale_x_log10(labels = scales::label_dollar()) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::label_percent(scale = 1)) + labs( x= "GDP per Capita", y = "Female Labor Force Participation", title = "Wealth and female labor force participation", caption = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", # will not show up! color = "Region" ) + scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma") + theme_minimal() + aes(label = country) # need so ggplot retains label for plotly ggplotly(wealth_flfp, tooltip = c("country", "flfp", "gdp_pc")) |> layout(annotations = list(text = "Source: World Bank Development Indicators", font = list(size = 10), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = 1.1, xanchor = 'right', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = -.1, yanchor = 'auto', yshift = 0)) |> # add web address layout(annotations = list(text = "www.dataviz-gwu.rocks", font = list(size = 10, color = 'grey'), showarrow = FALSE, xref = 'paper', x = .5, xanchor = 'center', xshift = 0, yref = 'paper', y = 1, yanchor = 'top', yshift = 0)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: :::
